availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Thompson, Sr. (Trigg County, Kentucky, judge, merchant, and politician.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, judge, merchant, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Hill Thompson in Trigg County, Kentucky, on October 30, 1828. Father of Zebulon Thompson, George V. Thompson, Elizabeth C. Thompson, Cornelia J. Thompson, and Thomas C. Thompson. Married to Ann Elizabeth Burbridge Thompson in Trigg County, Kentucky, on March 6, 1844. Father of Walter S. Thompson, James E. Thompson, Jr., and Sarah Thompson. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Trigg County in 1832. Clerk in Trigg County in 1850. Owned twenty-eight enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. County judge in Trigg County from 1851 to 1858. Owned Susan [Unknown], Mariah [Unknown], Catharine [Unknown], and Mary [Unknown] in Trigg County in 1852. Merchant in Trigg County in 1860. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.
